alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Burlington; Camden; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 6:28PM EDT until July 29 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Atlantic County in southern New Jersey... Southeastern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... Southeastern Camden County in southern New Jersey... Southeastern Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 627 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Elwood-Magnolia, or 14 miles northeast of Vineland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Hammonton, Egg Harbor City, Tuckerton, Weymouth, Surf City, Port Republic, Pomona, Elwood-Magnolia, Wading River, Bass River State Forest, Batsto, New Gretna, Beach Haven West, Mizpah, Mystic Island, Folsom, Manahawkin, Collings Lakes and Ocean Acres. This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 42 and 64. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 14 and 31. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
